title: What are some examples of empirical truths? - Quora

response.answer_text: If we have arbitrary definitions of words, we can prove what we want using language. “Empirical” is a very interesting and much misused word. It is derived from “empirikos”, which translates as “experience”. It is, then, an empirical truth that we experience the world. However, that's all that can be said without logical induction or deduction. Here's why:  Word definitions are always ironic. One can see from this set of words that “experience” of the word “empirical” definitely does not allow logical associations to be formed between it and other words which are not itself. What empirical method would allow that? Clearly, no method for assembling ontology can be empirical. How is “abstract connectivity of meaning” observed? It's not. Verification is a logical procedure. It is necessarily so. Observations produce no necessities. See how the definition uses sleight of hand? “Pure” logic? What logic is “not quite logic but a fusion of logic and something else”? Also, how do the synonyms of factual and real follow? They are not verifiable by observation without recourse to logic. It's really quite funny. See, etymology is everything. If we forget where words come from, what we say can make sense by invention. This is what empiricism attempts to avoid, rightly. However, it cannot reveal truth by itself. From their word-origins, the components of the famous phrase “verified by empirical evidence” translate to “it is true because I clearly experienced it”. If our perceptions define truth then this is true. If we are fallible at all, it is ironic.

Here is a short list of empirical truths: • How tall is the Eiffel tower? … 300M • What shape is the earth? … Nearly Spherical • How old is the earth? … Approximately 4.5 Billion years • Where was Barack Obama born? … Hawaii • Do vaccines cause autism? … No • Does contraception prevent abortion? … Yes • Did Trump have the largest inauguration crowd? … No • What are the origins of biodiversity? … Biological evolution • Does reality exist? … Yes • Does reality supersede conjecture? … Yes • Is reality our common ground? … Yes See: Facing Facts - Wikiversity
